skills.name: Use the order of operations to carry out calculations involving addition, subtraction, multiplication, and/or division
Use the order of operations to carry out calculations involving brackets

explanations.A: Out of addition and multiplication, which do you do first?
explanations.B: Addition and subtraction are performed left to right. Multiplication is done before addition.
explanations.C: Think about your order of operations. What comes first in each calculation?
explanations.D: Even though BIDMAS lists addition before subtraction, they are actually the same priority. We work from left to right.

explanations.A: Even though BIDMAS lists addition before subtraction, they are actually the same priority. We work from left to right.
explanations.B: Think about your order of operations. What comes first in each calculation?
explanations.C: Addition and subtraction are performed left to right. Multiplication is done before addition.
explanations.D: Out of addition and multiplication, which do you do first?

explanations.A: Multiplication and division are performed left to right. They are done before addition.
explanations.B: Multiplication and division have the same priority. They are performed from left to right.
explanations.C: Out of addition and division, which do you do first?
explanations.D: Think about your order of operations. What comes first in each calculation?

explanations.A: Think about your order of operations. What comes first in each calculation?
explanations.B: Out of addition and division, which do you do first?
explanations.C: Multiplication and division have the same priority. They are performed from left to right.
explanations.D: Multiplication and division are performed left to right. They are done before addition.

explanations.A: What gets squared in problem Q?
explanations.B: Brackets are done before indices, and indices are done before addition.
explanations.C: Think about your order of operations. What value gets squared in each calculation?
explanations.D: What gets squared in problem P?

explanations.A: What gets squared in problem P?
explanations.B: Think about your order of operations. What number gets squared in each calculation?
explanations.C: Brackets are done before indices, and indices are done before addition.
explanations.D: What gets squared in problem Q?

explanations.A: Out of addition, subtraction and multiplication, which do you do first?
explanations.B: Multiplication is done before either addition or subtraction.
explanations.C: Out of addition, subtraction and multiplication, which do you do first?
explanations.D: Think about the order of operations. What does BIDMAS mean?

explanations.A: Out of addition, subtraction and multiplication, which do you do first?
explanations.B: Out of addition, subtraction and multiplication, which do you do first?
explanations.C: Multiplication is done before either addition or subtraction.
explanations.D: What does order of operations mean? Try doing the calculation in different orders.

explanations.A: Think about your order of operations. What operations are there here?
explanations.B: What effect does putting in brackets have on the order?
explanations.C: Brackets are done before multiplication, and multiplication is done before addition.
explanations.D: Think about the order of operations. What does BIDMAS mean?
